organization.fullName: General Hospital of Ningxia Medical University

identificationModule.briefTitle: Non-invasive vs Invasive Cardiac Output Monitoring During Cesarean Section
identificationModule.officialTitle: Non-invasive vs Invasive Cardiac Output Monitoring in Patients Under Spinal Anesthesia During Cesarean Section: a Prospective Observational Study

leadSponsor.name: General Hospital of Ningxia Medical University

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This study aims to evaluate the consistency of hemodynamic monitoring between NICAP and NICCO technologies (T20A; Chongqing, China) and the traditional pulse wave analysis method (EV1000; USA).
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: The uterine placenta lacks autonomous regulatory ability, thus making maternal cardiac output (CO) the primary source of blood supply. Therefore, monitoring hemodynamics, including maternal CO, is of significant importance and provides guidance for anesthesia decisions such as fluid management and the administration of vasopressors during cesarean section. This study aims to evaluate the consistency of hemodynamic monitoring between NICAP and NICCO technologies (T20A; Chongqing, China) and the traditional pulse wave analysis method (EV1000; USA).

armGroups.label: Normotensive pregnant women
armGroups.description: Singleton pregnancy ≥37 weeks, American Society of Anesthesiologists physical status classification I to II scheduled for cesarean section under spinal anesthesia

secondaryOutcomes.measure: The incidence of post-spinal anesthesia hypotension
secondaryOutcomes.description: Systolic blood pressure (SBP) \< 80% of the baseline

secondaryOutcomes.measure: The incidence of severe post-spinal anesthesia hypotension
secondaryOutcomes.description: Systolic blood pressure (SBP) \< 60% of the baseline

secondaryOutcomes.measure: The incidence of nausea and vomiting.
secondaryOutcomes.description: Presence of nausea and vomiting in patients after spinal anesthesia
Systolic blood pressure (SBP) \>120% of the baseline

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* 18-45 years
* Primipara or multipara
* Singleton pregnancy ≥37 weeks
* American Society of Anesthesiologists physical status classification I to II
* Scheduled for cesarean section under spinal anesthesia

Exclusion Criteria:

* Body height \< 150 cm
* Body weight \> 100 kg or body mass index (BMI) ≥ 40 kg/m2
* Eclampsia or chronic hypertension or baseline blood pressure ≥140 mmHg
* Hemoglobin \< 7g/dl
* Fetal distress, or known fetal developmental anomaly
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Singleton pregnancy ≥37 weeks, American Society of Anesthesiologists physical status classification I to II scheduled for cesarean section under spinal anesthesia

overallOfficials.name: Yi Chen, M.D.
